title: Gay Christmas Nativity Angers Italian Conservatives
text: And christmas birth in which they appear two mothers of baby jesusInstead of the traditional figures of Mary and Joseph, instigated The anger of conservative Catholics and Italian politicians. Nativity scenes are popular in largely Catholic Italy, but in recent years they have become embroiled in the culture wars. Society has become more secular and multicultural. The parish priest of the Church of Saints Peter and Paul in Capocastello di Mercogliano, a village in the province of Avellino, located an hour’s drive east of Naples, defended the representation of the birth of Jesus. “I wanted to show through this scene that families are no longer just traditional” “I wanted to show with this scene that families are no longer just traditional,” he said. reuters and Father Vitaliano Della Sala. [Read Also: Terror reigns in Thailand's court: the king's concubine goes missing and her rival fears her fate](https://nationworldnews.com/terror-reigns-in-thailands-court-the-kings-concubine-goes-missing-and-her-rival-fears-her-fate/) “In our parishes we see more and more children new type of family who exist and are part of our society, the children of the separated and divorced, lesbian couples, singles, young moms, Della Sala, known for being sympathetic to LGBT and left-wing issues, claims his stance is in line with that of Pope Francis, who this week took the historic step of allowing priests to bless gay couples. “The LGBT sect offends those who have always had respect for the Holy Family.” However, Senator Maurizio Gaspari of the co-ruling Forza Italia party said the LGBT cult “offends all those who have always had respect and devotion for the Holy Family.” The group Pro-Vita & Famiglia (Pro-Life and Family) called it “dangerous, as well as shameful and reprehensible”. Pro-Vita, which launched an online petition asking the Bishop of Avellino to intervene, claims the nativity scene contradicts the Church’s teachings on the family and legalizes gay parenthood and surrogacy.
